How to Enter BIOS: 8 Steps (with Pictures) - wikiHow

 Log in / Sign up   
 Desktop Site   
 Talk How to Enter BIOS   
 Do you need to change your boot device or set your system clock? The BIOS is the place for you. The BIOS controls all of the low-level functions of your PC, and you'll need to access it if you want to make any changes. Accessing the BIOS varies from computer to computer, but the basic process is the same. 
 Steps Edit 
 Method One of Two: Entering Your BIOS Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d9\/Enter-BIOS-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Enter-BIOS-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/d9\/Enter-BIOS-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Reboot your computer.  Since the BIOS controls your system’s most basic functions, you have to access it before Windows loads.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2e\/Enter-BIOS-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Enter-BIOS-Step-2-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/2e\/Enter-BIOS-Step-2-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Press the Setup key.  As soon as you see the manufacturer’s logo, press the key specified to enter Setup or BIOS. The most common keys are F1, F2 and Delete.
 If you don’t hit the key in time, Windows will load and you will have to reboot and retry. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2d\/Enter-BIOS-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Enter-BIOS-Step-3-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/2d\/Enter-BIOS-Step-3-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Navigate the BIOS.  Once you have loaded the BIOS, you can use your keyboard to navigate the menus. Your mouse will most likely not be working. You can use the BIOS to change the basic settings for your hardware.
 Advertisement 
 Method Two of Two: Entering UEFI Settings for Windows 8 Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0f\/Enter-BIOS-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Enter-BIOS-Step-4-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0f\/Enter-BIOS-Step-4-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Open the Charms bar and click the Settings button.  You can access the Charms bar by moving your mouse to the upper- or lower-right corner of the screen.
 If you are using Windows 8, you've probably noticed that your computer’s boot sequence is too fast to hit the Setup key. Because of this, Windows 8 allows you to boot into an Advanced menu. You have to perform this action within Windows. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c6\/Enter-BIOS-Step-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Enter-BIOS-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/c6\/Enter-BIOS-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Click the Power button. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bd\/Enter-BIOS-Step-6.jpg\/v4-460px-Enter-BIOS-Step-6.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/bd\/Enter-BIOS-Step-6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Hold  . Shift and click "Restart". 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/02\/Enter-BIOS-Step-7.jpg\/v4-460px-Enter-BIOS-Step-7.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/02\/Enter-BIOS-Step-7.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Click “Troubleshoot” and then "Advanced options". 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/31\/Enter-BIOS-Step-8.jpg\/v4-460px-Enter-BIOS-Step-8.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/31\/Enter-BIOS-Step-8.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 5 
 Click "UEFI Firmware Settings".  You may have to click "Restart" again.
 This will allow you to change your UEFI settings, which are similar to your BIOS settings. 
 Advertisement 
 Community Q&A

 Add New Question 
 How do I reset BIOS with an external monitor? 
								Answered by  
								wikiHow Contributor							 
 1: Power on.  2: Press Fn + F8.  3: Press F2 or Delete key depending on your notebook to enter BIOS.  (You can do 3 before 2.) 
 Thanks! 
 5 
 4 
 Why does my detachable keyboard not work in Chrome if it works in Windows 8? 
								Answered by  
								wikiHow Contributor							 
 Your keyboard might not be compatible with all operating systems. Check the specifications of your hardware for further details. 
 Thanks!

 Don’t change any settings with the BIOS unless you are sure about what you are doing.
